title: Project Coordinator
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description :

To manage projects by supervising and coordinating the site activities
Monitoring of work progress, attending project meetings, liaising with clients and consultants
Carrying out all shop drawings, method statements submission
Ensures the timely preparation of project progress reports, inspection records, handover records, defects list etc. Record all defects of works, ensure proper documentation for all variation orders and others
Ability to complete and hand over projects within tight timeline and quality expectation
To make pro-active response on site problems and resolved immediately with the Project team
To ensure all aspect of QA and QC matters
Observe proper construction safety measures and ensure safety compliance at site
Any other duties as assigned

Requirements:

A bachelor's degree or at least a high school diploma and other relevant qualifications
Min 2 years of relevant working experience in interior fit-out works or construction field is required
Able to work independently and under tight schedule
Good project coordination and management skill
Able to read architectural & technical drawings thus translates to construction activities
Possess relevant safety certifications like BCSS

title: Project Manager
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
As a Software Consultant at One Technosoft, you will play a key role in assisting our clients in optimizing their software development processes and IT systems. You will work closely with clients to understand their specific needs, provide expert recommendations, and oversee the successful implementation of software solutions. Your expertise will contribute to our clients' success and the growth of our consulting practice.
Key Responsibilities:
Client Assessment: Conduct thorough assessments of clients' software and IT systems to identify inefficiencies, challenges, and opportunities for improvement.
Solution Recommendation: Collaborate with clients to define their software requirements and provide recommendations for customized software solutions, software architecture, and technology stack.
Project Management: Lead or participate in software development and IT projects, ensuring they are delivered on time and within budget. This may include project planning, resource allocation, and risk management.
Technical Expertise: Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in software development and IT. Share this knowledge with clients to help them make informed decisions.
Client Communication: Maintain clear and effective communication with clients throughout the project lifecycle, addressing concerns, providing progress updates, and managing expectations.
Quality Assurance: Oversee software testing and quality assurance processes to ensure the final product meets the client's requirements and is free of defects.
Documentation: Prepare detailed project documentation, including project plans, technical specifications, and user manuals.
Training: Training will be provided to support to clients' teams, enabling them to effectively use and maintain the implemented software solutions.

title: PROJECT ENGINEER
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB DESCRIPTION

Prepare / review as built iso for claim purpose, follow up with client for any outstanding DO issue
To prepare progress claim report and submit progress claim documents according to client requirement
To prepare operations and maintenance manual after project completion
To coordinate with inter-departments for operations matters (procurement, engineering, group office)

Diploma or Degree in Mechanical Engineering
At least 3 years of working experience in the related field
Familiarity with semi-conductor/construction industry
Proficient in Microsoft Office
Knowledge of QA/QC procedure (PQR/WPS) will be an added advantage
Multi-tasking team player with excellent interpersonal and communications skills
Attended QEHS related awareness training

title: Project Accountant
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A market leader in the Manufacturing industry is seeking a Project Accountant to join their fast-growing organisation.
Reporting to the Finance Director, you will be the key driver in the management of financial transactions (Payments, Receivables, Journal entities), reporting, forecasts, budgets. You will be a key business partner to functions like project engineers, managers and sales team pertaining to supplier payments, bank guarantees, cash forecasts and tax/audit preparation. This involves driving management reporting for stakeholders, as well as overseeing the fixed assets, and preparation of financial for project reviews.
The ideal candidate should have a degree in Accountancy and Finance and have minimum of 4 years of relevant project accounting experience. You enjoy working both independently and within a team, while possessing strategic thinking and the ability to drive changes for the growth of the business.
If you are keen, please click on the link to apply or email me with your updated CV at jillian.yip@ethosbc.com. Alternatively, if you are looking out within the finance space, feel free to send across your resume.

title: Project Engineer / Senior Project Engineer (Electrical)
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Description
Responsible for taking over the project from tender / sales team for execution
Prepare PEPL’s Scope of work and create project schedule based on the scope - document submission list, material submission list, material lead time, installation and testing period
Create Document submission & Material submission list and prepare submissions
Design & review the drawings and documents for timely submission to customer
Monitor submissions & follow up with customer for timely approval of the documents & material submissions
Prepare Purchase Requisitions for purchase of necessary project materials on time and coordinate with purchase team and our subcontractor / supplier
Plan the construction site manpower requirement together with Superintendent
Coordinate with Superintendent / Construction Manager / Site supervisor for site work activities installation, testing & commissioning and progress report
Maintain & update Project schedule regularly and prepare Weekly / Monthly Progress report for internal & customer
Participate in regular customer meetings & proactively manage customer expectations by preparing necessary submissions / agenda / minutes of meeting etc.
Manage the project cost within allocated budget
Maintain Change Order Log and proactively manage change in scope. Prepare RFI / VOR and get VO from customer before executing the scope change.
Prepare Progress Claims timely and follow up for approval and maintain Progress Claim Summary report
Escalate challenges / issues to the Project Manager & management to resolve it on time
Collaborate with Customer, Consultant, Owner, Third Parties, Suppliers & internal team members for successful project execution
Organize & coordinate for Factory Acceptance Testing (FAT) of necessary equipment
Perform pre-punch list walk thru with PM and Superintendent
Clearing of punch list defects in collaboration with site team
Prepare & provide training to customer for necessary equipment (as applicable)
Responsible to collect all Handover & completion documents
Manage & Comply with Workplace Safety & Health for project execution
Organize necessary safety training for the project & site team members
Comply with the PQP document for project execution
Requirement
Diploma/Degree in Electrical Engineering or related studies
More than 3 years of project management experience in related field
Experienced in handling multiple projects
Possess effective organizational and follow-up skills, meticulous
Good interpersonal skills and able to interface with all levels, internally and externally, in a professional and responsive manner

title: Project Designer
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Andy Fisher Workshop Pte Ltd (AFW) is a Singapore-based design consultancy offering integrated Building Design and Interior Design services across SE Asia. We are seeking applicants with proven experience especially in hospitality, residential, high-end residential hospitality, commercial or mixed-use projects, for the role of Project Designer in our growing studio.
Role Responsibilities:
Manage complex multiple aspects of project coordination, including documentation coordination with consultant team, client and contractors.
Review and evaluate construction drawings, specifications, details for implementation at site, RFI and other site queries.
Visit site to review progress, quality and to resolve technical, material and coordination issues to ensure design intent and quality is maintained.
Work with the design team to revise and manage the preparation, revision and issue of construction related drawings, documents and details.
Role Requirements:
Excellent communicator – both graphically and verbally.
Ability to multi-task and meet given deadlines.
A good team player – communicative, self-motivated, willing to take initiative and open minded.
Demonstrate minimum 10 years relevant experience.
Relevant educational qualifications (degree/diplomas/professional accreditation).
Excellence in AutoCAD, Photoshop, 3D and presentation software. BIM experience is a plus.

title: Project Engineer

title: IT Project Manager
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description：
Managing IT infrastructure end-to-end from inception to closure
Support solutions team in pre-project sizing and planning
Manage scope, budget, cashflow, risks, issues in overall project plan
Present weekly progress reports, budget utilization and projection to management and project steering committee.
Manage the internal and external project stakeholders
Provide guidance to project team members including disambiguating requirements •Develop project documentation and artifacts required for execution such as risk register, security exceptions, known issue list
Organize and conduct project meetings and steerco meetings
Ensure project objectives are aligned and met including scope, cost and schedule
Ensure adherence to the company prevailing change management processes
Document project plans, knowledgebase and learnings
Be the point of contact during the project for all aspects of the engagement

Requirements:
IT and Project Management Certifications- PMP, PRINCE2, ITIL v4, CITPM, PMI-ACP
Minimum 3+ years project management experience, completing at least 5 large scale customer facing infrastructure projects
Good understanding of Unified Communications, Contact Centre, Networking and Cloud infrastructure
Experience in Avaya solutions preferred
Strong leadership skills, team player with strong communication skills
Possess critical thinking skills, combined with the ability to present clearly both verbally and in written form
Highly self-motivated, capable of working independently and technically competent in carrying out tasks
Good communication skills with ability to interact with business and technical subject matter experts
Fluent in English and Chinese (written and spoken)

title: Senior Project Engineer
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Connect Energy partners with one of the biggest LNG player in Singapore to look for the following position.

Responsibilities
Project Management: Lead and oversee the planning, execution, and completion of engineering projects related to the LNG terminal. Develop project plans, schedules, and budgets to ensure timely and cost-effective project delivery.
Technical Expertise: Provide technical leadership and guidance to project teams. Review and approve engineering designs, specifications, and technical documentation. Ensure adherence to industry best practices and safety standards.
Risk Management: Identify potential project risks and develop mitigation strategies. Monitor and manage project risks throughout the project lifecycle.
Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, including contractors, suppliers, regulatory authorities, and other departments within Company. Maintain effective communication channels to ensure project objectives are met.
Quality Assurance: Implement quality control and assurance processes to ensure the highest standards of engineering excellence are maintained. Conduct regular inspections and audits to verify compliance.
Safety and Compliance: Ensure all project activities comply with safety regulations and environmental standards. Promote a culture of safety and risk awareness within the project team.
Budget and Cost Control: Monitor project expenditures and manage budgets effectively. Identify cost-saving opportunities and implement cost-control measures where necessary.
Documentation: Maintain accurate project documentation, including project reports, progress updates, and technical documentation. Ensure all records are complete and accessible for future reference.
Technical Problem Solving: Address technical challenges and troubleshoot engineering issues that may arise during project execution. Implement innovative solutions to optimize project outcomes.
Qualifications and Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Engineering (preferably in Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, or related field).
Minimum of 8 years of experience in project engineering, with a proven track record in managing complex engineering projects, preferably in the energy or petrochemical industry.
Strong knowledge of engineering principles, project management methodologies, and relevant industry codes and standards.
Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in project management software and tools.
Commitment to safety and environmental stewardship.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a multidisciplinary team.

title: CONSTRUCTION PROJECT MANAGER
company: SBA CONSTRUCTION & ENGINEERING SERVICES PTE. LTD.
address: UNION INDUSTRIAL CENTER, 3 LORONG BAKAR BATU 348741
job_category: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Customer Service, Human Resources
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
PROJECT MANAGER SKILLS
Communication: Project managers must be effective communicators to convey ideas, expectations, and information to their team, stakeholders, and clients.
Leadership: They need to be able to lead their team to success by providing clear direction, motivation, and support.
Organization: They must be highly organized to manage multiple tasks, timelines, and resources simultaneously.
Time management: They must be able to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively to ensure deadlines are met.
Risk management: They must be able to identify potential risks and take measures to mitigate them before they can negatively impact the project.
Budget management: They need to be able to manage project budgets and make informed decisions to ensure the project stays within budget.
Problem-solving: They must quickly identify and solve problems that may arise during a project.
Adaptability: They must be adaptable and adjust plans and strategies to keep the project on track.
Teamwork: They must be able to work collaboratively with their team to achieve project goals.
Technical expertise: They must have a good understanding of the technical aspects of the project and be able to communicate effectively with technical team members.

title: Project Engineer (Oversea, Project Management Development) - JY
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job ID: 18638
Location: Tuas West Road, Oversea
Working hours: 10 hrs a day, 60 hrs a week minimally (Sundays off)
Salary: up to $4,300 (Depending on experiences)
Job Description
Our client is looking for multiple Project Engineers to join their main Project Management Development team at the HQ. This role will assist Construction or Project Manager in Project planning, cost control, monitoring, coordination, engineering and design reviews, method statement risks assessments, vendor data, procurement related issues, coordination with discipline engineers and other contractors / vendors to meet schedule and budget. There are ongoing projects in Singapore and Middle East (Qatar, Saudi Arabia etc) and the candidate may be sent overseas on business trips depending on suitability.
Project co-ordination with Client, Engineering Department, business units, vendors, subcontractors and Procurement Department for all project activities.
Co-ordinate with the site construction team for Installation, Testing and commissioning works.
Project Planning, Progress Reports and Claims.
Interpret Construction and Technical Drawings
Material Take offs
Evaluation of vendor quotation on Technical and Commercial aspects.
Preparation of Method of Statement, Risk Assessments for various installation works.
Plan monthly work schedule and set productivity to be achieved.
To monitor the progress of projects.
To initiate and undertake action to prevent the occurrence of non-conformity.
To be proactive in creating a safe working environment for everyone and ensuring that HSE in-house rules are observed at all times.
To consider HSE aspects when planning and carrying out tasks to eliminate and reduce HSE hazards, aspects and risks.
Job Requirement
Preferably Diploma or Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent.
Preferably 2-3 years of relevant working experience in a similar capacity in Oil and Gas petrochemical construction industry.
Extensive knowledge of Engineering, Procurement, Project controls and Construction work processes.
Interested applicants, kindly send your updated resume to Joanne (R21101135) Joanne@pasona.com.sg with the email subject header "Job Application for 18638, Project Engineer (Project Management Development)".

title: Project Coordinator (Metocean)
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Project Coordinator (PC) is a member of the Marine Metocean Surveys Service Line and is involved in projects in the Asia Pacific Region.

The PC will work together with the Project Managers and is responsible for:
- Compliance with Fugro’s and client’s Document Control procedures and keeping the Master Document Registers up to date.
- Setting up and amending Project schedules for the Project Managers.
- Preparation of Project Documentation, like Project Execution Plans, any required bridging documents, which need to comply with the Fugro Document Standard (FDS).
- Data input and verification of correct information in our Fugro Enterprise Resource Planning software, IFS, and, if required, coordinating with procurement in projects.
- Minute of Meetings and/or Action Tracker preparation.

The PC provides a supporting role to projects through the coordination of project related activities, such as logistics, resourcing, training, progress updates, project tracking, preparation of meeting minutes amongst others.
The PC works in accordance with the Fugro Project Management Handbook, ensuring that the agreed work is carried out efficiently.

The goal is to grow in a role of becoming a Junior Project Manager and later as a Project Manager.
PS: To become more familiar with the industry we are working in, the PC could go to site on a project.

Essential Requirements:
Previous experience in project administration for / related to the oil & gas and/or marine survey industry; knowledgeable administering projects / operation in multiple regions / countries preferred
Strong communication skills with excellent command of written and spoken English; preference given if capable to communicate in other Asian / local languages
Some previous experience in resource planning; financial planning, tracking and control; documentation development and tracking
Team player with leadership skills;
Planning and analytical skills with experience in relevant techniques and software application, strong problem-solving skills
High focus on project quality and HSE performance, experience in risk assessment techniques and exercise

Desirable Experience:
Degree (or equivalent) in project or business management
Experience working with multinational company
Minimum 3 years working experience in relevant field, in marine survey and/or energy industry

title: Special Project Executive
job_category: Events / Promotions, General Management, General Work
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a highly motivated and organised Special Project Executive to lead and manage strategic initiatives and special projects within our company. The role requires a dynamic individual with strong project management skills, analytical thinking and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. The Special Project Executive will play a pivotal role in driving innovation, operational excellence and achieving the company’s strategic goals.

Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Project Management, or related field (Master's preferred).
Proven experience in project management, including successful execution of complex projects.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
Ability to lead cross-functional teams and foster a collaborative work environment.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Adaptability and flexibility to manage multiple projects in a dynamic environment.
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
